column5: What a beautiful day today! Low winds, high sun and no work. I mapped out a new lake just 30 minutes north of town that Fish-Online indicated it held walleye--- they aren't always correct, but I figured they were right this time since this very small lake is attached to bigger lake known to contain walleye. I ate a balogna and hot sauce sandwich at the launch, starred down this 70 hectare lake and launched the canoe at 3:30.  Paddled and drifted for about an hour when I got my first bite!    She was 57cms long, 3 shy of the 60cms slot limit. ... don't go by the tape reading in the photo hahaha    I paddled nearly the whole shoreling, dragging and popping white maribou jigs tipped with minnows off the bottom, in 8-14 feet of stained water.      At one point the bottom livened up and my 3/8 oz jig was bouncing on rocks; as soon as I felt the rocks a big perch smashed my jig. ...new perch PB!!! 14 inches and full of crayfish. I kinda screwed up by taking a measurment shot and not displaying my TEAM 8 OFC Tourny Logo.. Minutes later I cleaned them and go 4 walleye sized filets. Sorry Team 8, but I am NOT going down the garbage shoot to recover the carcass.      Well, that was my day. Tomorrow is Vac day #2 and my GF is joining! Can't wait.
Sounds like a fun day to me.
A great day for sure...but bologna and hot sauce sandwiches? I need a retching emoticon. LOL!
Good day on the water. I'm off tomorrow too. If you don't want to rent come grab my punt and 4hp.
Thanks for the early morning laff  Looks like a great way to spend a day !!
I'm just preparing for todays outing. It's nice to sleep in somedays.  If anyone is wondering, this is what my sandwich looks like. PM me if you'd like the recipe.
Good luck today!  Those are some decent perch.
Well then. We'll just have to see what Captain Geoff has to say about that.  Slayer
Nicely done Chad That walleye would of been a great upgrade for the team at 28" That perch too    but no worries.... still plenty of time Thanks for sharing Jacques
Rod Caster, that looks like an absolute awesome way to spend a day!!!  Nice catches to, looks like some blue tinge on that walleye? Or is it just the photo?
Those perch are huge! Nice little excursion.
Hey man at least it's not on Wonderbread and you've got some nice looking cheese there too. Two thumbs up!
Nice going.  I believe I've fished that lake.  Start with an S?

Beauty !!!!!!!!!!!! Looks like a peaceful place to spend the day.I am a constantly forgetting to get pics too. I mean really !!! Who thinks about a camera in the heat of a battle  Congrats on the monster perch too !!!

Yes it does. I fished another small lake further north today and only got a few pike. Beautiful weather made it all worth the effort!  Solo: only premium ingredients for this paddler hehe  Manitou; I didn't notice any blue, probably just the pic. That would have been neat though.  Mike01: franks indeed..xtra hot!  Slayer: don't worry; I don't think anybody has lost the OFC tourney because of just a few inches... Right? Hehe uh oh
